description: Drawing from his own experiences as a stripper, Channing Tatum stars as an exotic dancer at a Tampa nightclub who counsels a young protégé while nursing his dream of starting a custom furniture business.
title: Magic Mike
text:
Watch ... if you want some hunky gentleman to show you a good and funny time. Presided over by MatthewMcConaughey’s silver-tongued M.C., the dance sequences in “Magic Mike” emphasize the male stripper as an all-purpose entertainer, more about fantasy and fun than pure eroticism. There’s an essential silliness to the routines that’s distinct from female exotic dancing, and the dopey camaraderie extends to the dressing room and beyond, where most of these men work odd jobs and live hand-to-mouth. Tatum and director Steven Soderbergh are admirably comprehensive about showing the appeals and limitations of this line of work and the uncertain economy of grinding for every dollar.
Skip ... if the workaday lives of male strippers off the stage doesn’t sound that compelling. The modesty of “Magic Mike” has its appeal, but the question of whether or not Tatum will scrape together enough capital to start a custom furniture business is about as low-stakes as it gets.
